intro: Genista sibirica, commonly known as Siberian broom, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia and Central Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, wiry stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Its botanical features include a woody structure and the ability to thrive in poor, well-drained soils. Genista sibirica is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value.
